place.name: BOOTHBY PAGNELL
place.gazetteerText: BOOTHBY-PAGNELL, a parish in Grantham district, Lincoln; adjacent to the Great Northern railway, 1½ mile ESE of Great Ponton station, and 5 SE of Grantham. It has a post office, of the name of Boothby, under Grantham. Acres, 1,794. Real property, £2,431. Pop., 112. Houses, 22. The property is divided among a few. Boothby House is a chief residence. The parish is a meet for the Belvoir hounds. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £376.* Patron, T. Fardell, Esq. The church is good. The erudite Bishop Sanderson was rector here for forty years. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
